kitchen.title: 1. Grease Trap
kitchen.risk: Structural elimination of pipe blockage/odor risk
kitchen.bad: Only collecting floating oil and residue from the upper layer, leaving deposits on walls and bottom (source of odor).
kitchen.good: Complete removal of 3-layer structure: Collect all floating oil, sediment, and wastewater. Thoroughly clean walls and bottom with grease-degrading agent to eliminate root risks.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What is the most critical risk in grease trap cleaning?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Odor from grease remaining on walls and bottom, and pipe blockage when it solidifies.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What should be checked most after cleaning?
kitchen.qa2a: A: Whether drainage flows smoothly, whether water in the trap is becoming transparent, and whether slime remains on the walls.

kitchen.title: 2. U-shaped Drain & Grating
kitchen.bad: Only removing residue and wastewater from the drain, leaving slime on the back of grating and sides (risk of odor and pests).
kitchen.good: Disinfection and deodorization of slime: After removing residue, disinfect and clean slime on the sides. Thoroughly brush the back of the grating to eradicate sources of odor and pests.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What is the key to preventing odor recurrence in U-shaped drain cleaning?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Disinfection of biofilm (slime) formed on the sides, not just residue, and subsequent deodorization treatment.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What should be checked before replacing the grating?
kitchen.qa2a: A: Whether slime remains on the back, and whether there is any misalignment after installation (safety risk).

kitchen.title: 3. High-Pressure Pipe Cleaning
kitchen.bad: Accepting requests only after blockages occur, cleaning only visible areas, and not proposing preventive measures.
kitchen.good: Risk analysis and preventive proposals: Propose regular endoscopic checks. Record cleaning water data after cleaning to structurally prevent deterioration of pipe conditions.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What is the purpose of regular high-pressure cleaning?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Not responding after blockages occur, but understanding and preventing deterioration of pipe conditions through data before problems arise.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What data should be included in reports submitted to customers?
kitchen.qa2a: A: Pressure data before and after cleaning, or transparency and recovery amount of cleaning water, etc.

kitchen.title: 4. Range Hood Cleaning
kitchen.bad: Only wiping the filter surface, leaving oil on the internal centrifugal fan and casing (fire risk).
kitchen.good: Disassembly and soaking cleaning: Completely disassemble the centrifugal fan and soak it in specialized detergent. Eliminate oil accumulation that directly causes fires.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: Why are cleaning standards for range hoods particularly strict?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Because accumulated oil inside is in the most flammable state and is a major cause of kitchen fires.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What should be noted when disassembling and cleaning the centrifugal fan?
kitchen.qa2a: A: Completely removing water droplets and detergent residue after cleaning and ensuring it is dried (risk of motor failure and rust).

kitchen.title: 5. Duct Cleaning
kitchen.risk: Visualization and removal of hidden fire risks
kitchen.bad: Only cleaning the exterior, leaving oil accumulation at bends inside the duct (fire risk).
kitchen.good: Endoscopic inspection and scraping: Check oil accumulation with an endoscope, identify and remove high fire-risk points. Photograph the condition after cleaning.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What does 'risk mitigation' mean in duct cleaning?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Identifying and removing oil accumulation at bends and connection points that cannot be seen from the outside.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: Why is photographing after cleaning important?
kitchen.qa2a: A: As proof of work completion for customers and as compliance records for P (Integrated Platform).

kitchen.title: 6. Fire Shutter Cleaning
kitchen.risk: Elimination of emergency operation failure risk
kitchen.bad: Only wiping dust from the shutter surface, leaving dust and foreign matter inside the guide rail (operation failure risk).
kitchen.good: Cleaning before emergency operation test: Thoroughly clean inside the rail to eliminate emergency operation failure risk. Adjust the amount of operating oil applied to ensure operability.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What is the purpose of fire shutter cleaning?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Not aesthetics, but ensuring rapid and reliable operation during fires.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What should be checked in rail cleaning?
kitchen.qa2a: A: Not just dust, but whether there is rail distortion or foreign matter (directly related to operation failure).

kitchen.title: 7. Ventilation Fan Cleaning
kitchen.risk: Prevention of failure and noise risk
kitchen.bad: Only cleaning visible areas of fan blades, leaving dust and oil on the motor shaft (failure and noise risk).
kitchen.good: Dust prevention treatment of motor shaft: Disassemble the fan and thoroughly remove dust from not only the blades but also the casing and motor shaft. Apply specialized dust prevention agent to prevent failure and noise risks.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What risks occur if ventilation fan cleaning is insufficient?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Decreased exhaust efficiency plus failure and noise due to increased load on the motor shaft.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What should be noted when applying dust prevention agent?
kitchen.qa2a: A: Extreme care to ensure it does not come into contact with the motor or electrical systems.

kitchen.title: 8. Exhaust Fan Cleaning
kitchen.risk: Prevention of mold and rust risk
kitchen.bad: Only removing dust and oil from the fan surface, leaving condensation and water droplets inside the fan cover (mold and rust risk).
kitchen.good: Internal drying and rust prevention treatment: After disassembly and cleaning, completely remove condensation and water droplets inside the fan cover and apply rust prevention agent. Structurally prevent mold and rust risks from moisture.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: Where are the high mold and rust risk areas in exhaust fans?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Inside the fan cover where moisture accumulates and areas prone to condensation.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of rust prevention treatment?
kitchen.qa2a: A: Extending the service life of fan systems that are difficult to replace frequently and reducing store operation costs.

kitchen.title: 9. Exhaust Fan Belt Replacement and Adjustment
kitchen.bad: Replacing only after cracks or breaks occur in the belt, and adjusting tension after replacement based on feel.
kitchen.good: Data-based adjustment and recording: Measure belt tension before replacement, and adjust to specified values after installing new belt. Record adjustment data in P (Integrated Platform) for O (Optimization).
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What is the danger of 'feel-based adjustment' after belt replacement?
kitchen.qa1a: A: If tension is too high, it causes overload on the motor; if too low, it causes efficiency decrease due to slipping.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of recording in P (Integrated Platform)?
kitchen.qa2a: A: To manage replacement timing and adjustment data in a data-driven manner for O (Optimization) of maintenance cycles.

kitchen.title: 10. Kitchen Equipment Cleaning
kitchen.risk: Removal of food poisoning and pest sources
kitchen.bad: Only wiping visible parts of equipment surface and control panel, leaving gaps and back of equipment (pest and food poisoning risk).
kitchen.good: Disassembly, movement, and back cleaning: Move equipment as much as possible and clean contamination sources at the back and gaps with walls. Check with lighting to ensure no wiping residue remains.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in equipment cleaning?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Not surface aesthetics, but removal of food residue in gaps with walls and floors, which are breeding grounds for pests.
kitchen.qa2q: Q: Why check with lighting after cleaning?
kitchen.qa2a: A: To check for fine oil films and detergent residue that are difficult to see with the naked eye and ensure S (Standardization).

kitchen.title: 11. Wall Cleaning
kitchen.bad: Only wiping areas where oil has dripped, missing fine oil films over a wide area (odor and mold risk).
kitchen.good: Comprehensive steam cleaning and neutralization: Float oil films and water stains with steam cleaning and treat with specialized neutralizer. Avoid discoloration risk of wall materials and standardize hygiene conditions.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What risks do kitchen wall stains bring?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Odor from bacteria breeding on fine oil films and discoloration and deterioration of wall materials if left untreated.
kitchen.qa2a: A: To neutralize strongly alkaline detergents, protect wall materials, and eliminate the risk of detergent residue.

kitchen.title: 12. Sink Cleaning
kitchen.risk: Suppression of odor and hygiene risks from water areas
kitchen.bad: Only polishing the sink surface, leaving slime in the drain interior and overflow holes (odor and hygiene risk).
kitchen.good: Complete disinfection of drain interior and overflow holes: Thoroughly clean the drain interior and overflow holes where slime easily accumulates. Apply scale prevention agent to ensure maintenance of hygiene conditions.
kitchen.qa1q: Q: What is the most easily overlooked risk area in sink cleaning?
kitchen.qa1a: A: Not just the drain, but overflow holes (where slime easily accumulates and becomes a source of odor).
kitchen.qa2q: Q: What is the purpose of applying scale prevention agent?
kitchen.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions for an extended period after cleaning and suppress occurrence of hygiene risks until the next cleaning.

aircon.title: 13. Air Conditioner Filter Cleaning
aircon.risk: Prevention of energy efficiency and mold/allergy risks
aircon.bad: Only washing the filter surface with water and returning it before it is fully dry, promoting mold growth inside.
aircon.good: Complete drying and disinfection: After cleaning, ensure it is completely dry before installation. Record cleaning data and report energy efficiency improvements to customers through I (Connection Mechanism).
aircon.qa1q: Q: What is the most critical risk in filter cleaning?
aircon.qa1a: A: Decreased airflow efficiency due to dirt (increased energy costs) and mold recurrence due to insufficient drying (health risk).
aircon.qa2q: Q: What is the risk of installing before it is fully dry?
aircon.qa2a: A: Residual moisture evaporates inside the air conditioner, becoming a major cause of mold re-growth on the drain pan and fan.

aircon.title: 14. Air Conditioner Disassembly Cleaning
aircon.risk: Structural elimination of allergen and failure risks
aircon.bad: Insufficient cleaning of internal fins, leaving mold and dust attached to the drain pan and blower fan (allergy and failure risk).
aircon.good: Drain pan removal and anti-mold coating: Remove and clean the drain pan, completely disinfect mold spores inside the fan. After cleaning, apply anti-mold coating to ensure long-term air quality safety.
aircon.qa1q: Q: Why is disassembly cleaning necessary?
aircon.qa1a: A: Because microorganisms and mold inside the drain pan and fan that cannot be removed by filters are the direct causes of allergens and failures.
aircon.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of anti-mold coating?
aircon.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions after cleaning and structurally suppress mold re-growth risk during the period until the next cleaning.

floor.title: 15. Floor Cleaning
floor.risk: Maintenance of slip/fall risk and hygiene conditions
floor.bad: Only wiping surface dirt, leaving dirt in floor material gaps and caulking areas (slip and hygiene risk).
floor.good: Gap cleaning and anti-slip treatment: Thoroughly clean gaps in floor materials and caulking areas. After cleaning, appropriately apply anti-slip agent to structurally eliminate slip and fall risks.
floor.qa1q: Q: What is the most important risk mitigation in floor cleaning?
floor.qa1a: A: Not visual cleanliness, but elimination of slip and fall risks from dirt accumulated in floor material gaps.
floor.qa2q: Q: What is the importance of anti-slip treatment?
floor.qa2a: A: To prevent floors from becoming slippery after cleaning and ensure safety of employees and customers.

floor.title: 16. Flooring Cleaning
floor.risk: Prevention of damage and discoloration risk
floor.bad: Cleaning all at once with strong detergent, damaging the floor surface and causing discoloration.
floor.good: Appropriate detergent selection and protection: Select detergent suitable for the floor material and apply protective agent after cleaning. Extend floor material lifespan and maintain aesthetics.
floor.qa1q: Q: What should be noted in flooring cleaning?
floor.qa1a: A: Selecting appropriate detergent according to floor material type and preventing surface damage from excessive cleaning.
floor.qa2a: A: To protect floor materials after cleaning and suppress risks of damage and discoloration during the period until the next cleaning.

floor.title: 17. Tile Cleaning
floor.risk: Elimination of grout mold and discoloration risk
floor.bad: Only cleaning tile surfaces, leaving mold and dirt in grout areas (hygiene and aesthetics risk).
floor.good: Thorough grout cleaning and anti-mold treatment: Thoroughly clean grout areas with specialized brush and completely remove mold. After cleaning, apply anti-mold agent to prevent recurrence.
floor.qa1q: Q: What is the most easily overlooked area in tile cleaning?
floor.qa1a: A: Not tile surfaces, but mold and dirt accumulated in grout areas.
floor.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of anti-mold treatment?
floor.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of grout areas after cleaning and structurally suppress mold recurrence.

floor.title: 18. Carpet Cleaning
floor.risk: Removal of allergen and odor risks
floor.bad: Only vacuuming surface dirt, leaving mites and mold inside the carpet (allergy and odor risk).
floor.good: Deep cleaning and disinfection treatment: Clean deep into the carpet with steam cleaning to remove mites and mold. After cleaning, spray disinfectant to eradicate sources of allergens and odor.
floor.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in carpet cleaning?
floor.qa1a: A: Not surface dirt, but removal of mites and mold hidden inside the carpet.
floor.qa2q: Q: What is the importance of disinfection treatment?
floor.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions inside the carpet after cleaning and prevent recurrence of allergens and odor.

floor.title: 19. Waxing
floor.bad: Applying wax without base treatment, causing peeling and discoloration.
floor.good: Base treatment and appropriate application: Completely clean and dry the floor surface before base treatment, then apply wax with appropriate thickness. Balance protection and aesthetics.
floor.qa1q: Q: What is the most important step in waxing?
floor.qa1a: A: Base treatment. If base treatment is insufficient, wax peels easily and floor protection effectiveness decreases.
floor.qa2q: Q: What is appropriate wax thickness?
floor.qa2a: A: Appropriate thickness according to floor material type; too thin reduces protection effectiveness, too thick causes easy peeling.

floor.title: 20. Coating Treatment
floor.bad: Applying coating agent all at once, causing unevenness and peeling.
floor.good: Gradual application and leveling: Apply coating agent gradually and finish evenly. After application, ensure sufficient drying time to maximize protection effectiveness.
floor.qa1q: Q: What is the purpose of coating treatment?
floor.qa1a: A: To protect floor surfaces long-term and make daily maintenance easier.
floor.qa2q: Q: Why is gradual application important?
floor.qa2a: A: Because applying all at once causes unevenness and becomes a cause of peeling.

floor.title: 21. Floor Disinfection
floor.bad: Only spraying disinfectant after cleaning, insufficient disinfection of gaps in floor materials and caulking areas.
floor.good: Thorough disinfection and recording: Thoroughly disinfect even gaps in floor materials and caulking areas. Record disinfection data to ensure maintenance of hygiene conditions.
floor.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in floor disinfection?
floor.qa1a: A: Not just surfaces, but thoroughly disinfecting even gaps in floor materials and caulking areas.
floor.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of recording disinfection data?
floor.qa2a: A: To prove maintenance of hygiene conditions with data and provide peace of mind to customers.

floor.title: 22. Floor Protection
floor.bad: Finishing cleaning without protection treatment, leaving floor damage risk.
floor.good: Appropriate protective agent selection and application: Select protective agent suitable for floor material and apply with appropriate method. Structurally prevent floor damage risks.
floor.qa1q: Q: What is the importance of floor protection?
floor.qa1a: A: To protect floor surfaces after cleaning and prevent damage from daily use.
floor.qa2q: Q: What are the criteria for selecting protective agent?
floor.qa2a: A: Selecting appropriate protective agent according to floor material type and usage environment.

other.title: 23. Window Cleaning
other.bad: Only wiping window glass surface, leaving dirt and mold on sash areas (aesthetics and hygiene risk).
other.good: Thorough sash cleaning and anti-mold treatment: Thoroughly clean sash areas and remove mold. After cleaning, apply anti-mold agent to prevent recurrence.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most easily overlooked area in window cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Not window glass, but dirt and mold accumulated on sash areas.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of anti-mold treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of sash areas after cleaning and structurally suppress mold recurrence.

other.title: 24. Door Cleaning
other.bad: Only wiping door surface, leaving dirt on door handles and gaps (hygiene risk).
other.good: Thorough cleaning of door handles and gaps: Disinfect and clean door handles, and thoroughly clean gaps between door and wall. Balance hygiene and aesthetics.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in door cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Disinfection of door handles. Door handles are touched by many people, so hygiene risk is high.
other.qa2q: Q: Why is cleaning gap areas important?
other.qa2a: A: Because dirt accumulated in gaps can become breeding grounds for pests.

other.title: 25. Lighting Fixture Cleaning
other.risk: Prevention of illuminance decrease and fire risk
other.bad: Only wiping lighting fixture surface, leaving dust and dead insects inside (illuminance decrease and fire risk).
other.good: Internal cleaning and inspection: Disassemble lighting fixtures and remove dust and dead insects inside. Also perform inspection simultaneously to eliminate fire risks.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in lighting fixture cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Internal cleaning. Dust and dead insects accumulated inside cause illuminance decrease and fires.
other.qa2a: A: Because internal inspection is possible during cleaning, allowing early detection of failures and fire risks.

other.title: 26. Ventilation Opening Cleaning
other.risk: Prevention of air quality and mold risk
other.bad: Only wiping ventilation opening surface, leaving dust and mold inside (air quality and health risk).
other.good: Thorough internal cleaning and anti-mold treatment: Disassemble ventilation opening and remove dust and mold inside. After cleaning, apply anti-mold agent to prevent recurrence.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in ventilation opening cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Internal cleaning. Dust and mold accumulated inside cause air quality deterioration and health risks.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of anti-mold treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions inside ventilation opening after cleaning and structurally suppress mold recurrence.

other.title: 27. Toilet Cleaning
other.risk: Elimination of hygiene and odor risks
other.bad: Only cleaning toilet surface, leaving dirt on the back of toilet and floor (hygiene and odor risk).
other.good: Thorough disinfection and deodorization treatment: Thoroughly disinfect and clean even the back of toilet and floor. After cleaning, apply deodorizer to eradicate sources of odor.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in toilet cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Cleaning the back of toilet and floor. Dirt accumulated in these areas is a major cause of odor.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of deodorization treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of toilet after cleaning and structurally suppress odor recurrence.

other.title: 28. Hand Washing Area Cleaning
other.risk: Prevention of hygiene and scale risk
other.bad: Only cleaning hand washing area surface, leaving dirt in drain and faucet interior (hygiene and scale risk).
other.good: Thorough cleaning of drain and faucet: Thoroughly clean even the interior of drain and faucet. After cleaning, apply scale prevention agent to maintain hygiene conditions.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most easily overlooked area in hand washing area cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Interior of drain and faucet. Dirt accumulated in these areas causes hygiene risks.
other.qa2q: Q: Why apply scale prevention agent?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of hand washing area after cleaning and suppress scale occurrence.

other.title: 29. Mirror Cleaning
other.bad: Only wiping mirror surface, leaving dirt on mirror edges and gaps with wall (aesthetics risk).
other.good: Thorough cleaning of edges and gaps: Thoroughly clean even mirror edges and gaps with wall. After cleaning, apply protective agent to maintain aesthetics.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most easily overlooked area in mirror cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Mirror edges and gaps with wall. Dirt accumulated in these areas detracts from aesthetics.
other.qa2a: A: To protect mirror surface after cleaning and suppress dirt adhesion.

other.title: 30. Wall Surface Cleaning
other.risk: Prevention of aesthetics and mold risk
other.bad: Only cleaning visible parts of wall surface, leaving dirt and mold on upper parts and gaps of wall (aesthetics and health risk).
other.good: Comprehensive thorough cleaning and anti-mold treatment: Thoroughly clean even upper parts and gaps of wall surface. After cleaning, apply anti-mold agent to prevent recurrence.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most easily overlooked area in wall surface cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Upper parts and gaps of wall. Dirt and mold accumulated in these areas cause aesthetics and health risks.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of anti-mold treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of wall surface after cleaning and structurally suppress mold recurrence.

other.title: 31. Ceiling Cleaning
other.risk: Prevention of dust falling and mold risk
other.bad: Only cleaning visible parts of ceiling, leaving dust and mold on upper parts and gaps of ceiling (falling and health risk).
other.good: Thorough cleaning of upper parts and gaps: Thoroughly clean even upper parts and gaps of ceiling. After cleaning, apply anti-mold agent to prevent recurrence.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in ceiling cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Cleaning upper parts and gaps of ceiling. Dust and mold accumulated in these areas cause falling and health risks.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of anti-mold treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of ceiling after cleaning and structurally suppress mold recurrence.

other.title: 32. Elevator Cleaning
other.risk: Elimination of hygiene and safety risks
other.bad: Only cleaning elevator interior surface, leaving dirt on door gaps and floor (hygiene and safety risk).
other.good: Thorough cleaning of gaps and floor: Thoroughly clean even door gaps and floor. After cleaning, apply disinfectant to maintain hygiene conditions.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in elevator cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Cleaning door gaps and floor. Dirt accumulated in these areas causes hygiene and safety risks.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of disinfection treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of elevator interior after cleaning and suppress bacterial growth.

other.title: 33. Stair Cleaning
other.risk: Elimination of slip and fall risks
other.bad: Only cleaning stair surface, leaving dirt on step areas and handrails (slip and fall risk).
other.good: Thorough cleaning of steps and handrails: Thoroughly clean even step areas and handrails. After cleaning, apply anti-slip agent to eliminate slip and fall risks.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in stair cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Cleaning step areas and handrails. Dirt accumulated in these areas causes slip and fall risks.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of anti-slip treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To ensure stair safety after cleaning and structurally eliminate slip and fall risks.

other.title: 34. Trash Can Cleaning
other.risk: Elimination of odor and pest risks
other.bad: Only cleaning trash can surface, leaving dirt inside and on lid (odor and pest risk).
other.good: Thorough cleaning and disinfection of interior and lid: Thoroughly clean even trash can interior and lid. After cleaning, apply disinfectant to eradicate sources of odor and pests.
other.qa1q: Q: What is the most important point in trash can cleaning?
other.qa1a: A: Cleaning interior and lid. Dirt accumulated in these areas is a major cause of odor and pests.
other.qa2q: Q: What is the significance of disinfection treatment?
other.qa2a: A: To maintain hygiene conditions of trash can after cleaning and structurally suppress recurrence of odor and pests.
